item.title: Don't Listen to the Haters
item.description: [caption id="attachment_1913" align="alignright" width="300" caption="Robert Couse-Baker on Flickr"][/caption] “Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds.” -Albert Einstein The hardest thing I’ve encountered in becoming happy and successful is that it can make other people upset. Even if most people are happy for you, that one voice of resentment can destroy you. That provides a great excuse to hold yourself back: we’d rather be liked than happy (the absurdity of that statement should be apparent).
